Juneteenth: The commemoration of the emancipation of the final enslaved people in this nation in 1865. Today, we invite you to join DREAM leader Brandon Taylor for EmancipatED, a 3-part Juneteenth Hack-A-Thon for educators of color that starts this evening (http://emancipated.rsvpify.com). We share with you, below, the reflections of our 8th grade scholars. And moving forward, we commit to recognizing Juneteenth at DREAM as an official paid holiday.

This year, and every year, we must acknowledge and celebrate what this day means - and that it is just as much a part of our shared history in this country as the 4th of July or Memorial Day.

From teachers, to coaches, to friends, and mentors, every young person at DREAM has an extended family of supporters at his or her back.

Access to individualized support is essential, especially for kids in under-resourced neighborhoods. We partner with families to create wrap-around support networks for every DREAM scholar. Our youth know they can turn to an adult for support, so instead of worrying, they can feel confident about what comes next.

You can ensure that even more youth in East Harlem, the South Bronx, and Newark have access to the support systems they need to reach their dreams. Join us on a #DREAMtour to learn more.
